intro: Oxyanthus lepidus, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy, velvety leaves and showy yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in disturbed soils. Oxyanthus lepidus is sometimes considered an invasive species in certain areas due to its rapid growth and ability to spread easily.
